page.title: 08The A579 at Daubhill
page.content: The A579, known locally as{Derby St/St {Helen's Rd.}is lined on both sides mainly by shops, only a few old cottages remaining for residential purposes. In addition there are some single-storey factories. In a 1km survey of this busy, bustling road, we found a wide range of businesses - chip-shops, hairdressers, D.I.Y., TV & video, plumbers, fashion, furniture etc. Many of the shops serve the large local population of Asian families; this is reflected in the specialist food shops and clothing shops selling beautiful richly embroidered fabrics for saris. The 3 local schools - Pikes Lane, Sunninghill, and Clarendon - have large numbers of Asian pupils.
